channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Diners have eaten more than 35million Eat Out To Help Out meals in Rishi Sunak's half-price scheme
item.description: The Paddock Inn near Tenby, Pembrokeshire, says revellers taking advantage of the widely-popular scheme have shown 'extreme levels of rudeness' and caused staff 'nothing but grief'.

item.title: Diners have eaten more than 35million Eat Out To Help Out meals in Rishi Sunak's half-price scheme
item.description: The Paddock Inn near Tenby, Pembrokeshire, says revellers taking advantage of the widely-popular scheme have shown 'extreme levels of rudeness' and caused staff 'nothing but grief'.

item.title: Drive hands-free on the motorway IN MONTHS: Ministers draw up plans to approve 'lane-keeping' tech
item.description: Ministers are examining whether vehicles fitted with an Automated Lane Keeping System (ALKS) should be allowed to use it at speeds of up to 70mph on some of the country's busiest roads.

item.title: London homeowner to sue neighbour for 'revenge' fly-tipping
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: A homeowner has hit back at claims he fly-tipped in his wealthy neighbour's garden in Hounslow. Gurvindher Singh Luthra has threatened to sue his neighbour.

item.title: Bill Clinton's neck massaged by Jeffrey Epstein victim in photo
item.description: Bill Clinton is seen in photos sitting comfortably and smiling as Chauntae Davies, 22, rubs her hands into his shoulders. They were on a trip with Jeffrey Epstein to Africa in September of 2002.

item.title: Coronavirus: WHO says planet 'nowhere near' herd immunity
item.description: Dr Michael Ryan, the no-nonsense Irish epidemiologist in charge of the WHO's health emergencies programme, told people to stop pinning their hopes on the theory as a Covid fix-all.

item.title: Essex pub faces licence review after 600 attend garden party
item.description: The Beauvoir Arms in Downham, near Billericay, Essex, claim they only intended for 200 people to attend the event on August 2 to keep to social distancing rules.

item.title: British Airways' 747 retirement plan starts at Heathrow Airport
item.description: The aircraft, flying under flight number BA9170E, was pictured taking to the skies around 10.30am bound for Castellon in Spain, after more than 25 years of flying.

item.title: Thug who pushed female police officer during protest in Parliament Square jailed for two years
item.description: Jamie Dewing, 31, pushed a female police officer down a flight steps in Parliament Square on June 13, leaving her seriously injured. He pleaded guilty and has been jailed for two years.

item.title: Council shuts down Blackburn restaurant where police broke up 100-strong wedding reception
item.description: Waheed's Buffet and Banqueting Hall in Blackburn, Lancashire, was condemned by police for a 'significant breach' of lockdown restrictions after a wedding reception was reported on Sunday.

item.title: Russia DID interfere in 2016 election Senate Intel committee report reveals
item.description: A 1,000-page final report by the bipartisan Senate intel committee says Manafort was in touch with a Moscow intelligence officer, and Trump's campaign welcomed aid but did not collude.

item.title: 75% US dementia sufferers on drugs not made for the disease
item.description: A new study from the University of Michigan found antidepressants were the most common with about 50% receiving one prescription, likely to treat symptoms such as apathy and withdrawal.

item.title: Swiss town is covered in CHOCOLATE after malfunction at Lindt factory
item.description: The Lindt & Spruengli company confirmed local reports Tuesday that there was a minor defect in the cooling ventilation for a line for roasted "cocoa nibs" in its factory in Olten.

item.title: Lesbian influencers spark debate after giving away donor sperm as a prize
item.description: YouTubers Allie and Sam, from, Halifax, Nova Scotia, have sparked fierce debate after offering to give away a vial of donor sperm to their 225,000 fans on social media.

item.title: Roald Dahl fans are furious as campaigners force Sainsbury's to remove Matilda mugs from sale
item.description: Campaigners have accused the Miss Trunchbull-style mug of being 'hugely problematic' and encouraging domestic violence. But Roald Dahl fans have said this is 'idiocy'.

item.title: Rose McGowan accuses Alexander Payne of 'grooming' her
item.description: Rose McGowan (left) said her alleged ordeal with Alexander Payne (right) led her to quit acting before she returned to Hollywood after being 'discovered' at age 21.

item.title: Government AXE PHE and replace it with new institute run by former jockey Baroness Dido Harding
item.description: Baroness Dido Harding, a former Talk Talk chief executive and head of the UK's disastrous contact tracing scheme, was today appointed interim chief of the new National Institute for Health Protection.

item.title: Ellen DeGeneres blames introversion for 'mean' behavior in call
item.description: While Ellen, 62, is said to have spoken about some major changes in leadership in a bid to salvage the show, she also addressed rumors of her own alleged bad behavior.

item.title: Jakobsen thanks trauma doctors for saving his life after Poland horror-crash left him in a coma
item.description: The Deceuninck-QuickStep star's high-speed vault over the finish line barriers in Katowice had viewers recoiling after the talented sprinter's collision with rival Dylan Groenewegen.

item.title: Tiger Woods' son Charlie steals the show at junior tournament as golf star acts as his caddy
item.description: Charlie Woods came out on top in the youth event at Hammock Creek golf course on the weekend, hitting 3-under 33 as he won by five shots in a clean round with three birdies and no bogeys.

item.title: Coronavirus China: £100 vaccine may be on sale by December
item.description: State-owned pharmaceutical company Sinopharm claims the vaccine will be on the market by Christmas once phase three clinical trials in the United Arab Emirates are over.

item.title: NASA: Asteroid the size of a CAR flew less than 1,830 miles past Earth this weekend
item.description: The space rock passed over the Southern Hemisphere the same distance away from the surface of the Earth as the drive from Copenhagen, in Denmark, down to Málaga, in Spain.

item.title: Coronavirus: Female leaders saved lives acting 'decisively'
item.description: Female leaders such as New Zealand's Jacinda Ardern achieved 'systematically and significantly better' outcomes for their citizens amid coronavirus, research has suggested.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle 'pitch secret Hollywood project'
item.description: Sources say that the former royal couple began pitching their idea to 'numerous' media companies back in June, around the time that they purchased a sprawling estate in Santa Barbara.

item.title: Elephant shrew, thought 'lost to science' in 1968, seen in Africa
item.description: Having been considered 'lost to science' since 1968, the tiny mammal has been discovered in the rocky landscape of the Horn of Africa.

item.title: 'Stretched' universities face being overwhelmed by A-level U-turn
item.description: Elite universities in the UK face being overwhelmed by the u-turn as students who initially did not meet their offer requirements under the now-scrapped algorithm system now have the required grades.

item.title: People who filmed girl, 12, drown in Scottish river are slammed
item.description: The family of 12-year-old Ava Gray, who died in the River Leven in Balloch, Dunbartonshire, Scotland have criticised onlookers who filmed the search for her rather than helping the rescue effort.

item.title: Life on the Farm: 'Britain's loneliest shepherdess' has first baby
item.description: BBC2 documentary This Farming life has given a glimpse into the life of Britain's youngest solo shepherdess Emma Gray, who last year became a mother for the first time to her son Len.

item.title: Donald Trump calls Michelle Obama 'extremely divisive' and says 'SHE is in over her head'
item.description: Donald Trump criticized Michelle Obama Tuesday for her prerecorded Democratic Convention remarks, claiming the speech where she claimed he is in 'over his head' was 'extremely divisive.'

item.title: Kremlin-linked businessman boasted he knew about president's 'relationships with women' in Moscow
item.description: The Senate Intelligence Committee delivered the final volume of its Russia probe, where it explored Donald Trump's 'relationships with women in Moscow' and focused on Paul Manafort.

item.title: Traffic on Britain's roads returns to 93% of pre-pandemic levels
item.description: Government analysis recorded congestion last week hit 93 per cent of typical vehicle activity, after plummeting to as little as 23 per cent in April.

item.title: Woman who practised knife fights with her jihadist brother AVOIDS jail
item.description: Sneha Chowdhury, 26, knew her brother was practising knife fighting and rehearsing beheading attacks at the family home in Luton, a trial heard. She was today handed a suspended sentence.

item.title: Chinese woman, 88, dies when runaway dog's leash pulls her over
item.description: The victim was standing on a road in China when the pet ran past her. The dog's lead got caught around her feet and brought her to the ground. Police said the dog walker was 12 years old.

item.title: Coronavirus: Increased mutation 'may be a GOOD thing', expert says
item.description: Paul Tambyah, senior consultant at the National University of Singapore, says the dominant mutation D614G appears to be more infectious but less potent than the original strain.

item.title: De Blasio says he'll move homeless back into shelters after complaints over hotels
item.description: After widespread complaints, now de Blasio says he's going to reverse the plan to start moving them out of the hotels and back into shelters but he has given no set plan for how he will put it in motion.

item.title: COVID-19: Flush of a urinal causes coronavirus-laden particles to 'climb violently' into the air
item.description: Researchers from China simulated how particles are expelled from urinals when the latter are flushed - creating an invisible spray of potentially infectious droplets.

item.title: GCSE confusion as pupils get 'centre assessment grades' on Thursday but 'official results' next week
item.description: The Department for Education last night said that schools and college students would receive their 'centre assessment grades' on Thursday.

item.title: Jacob Rees-Mogg eats ice cream while wearing suit in Weymouth
item.description: The Conservative MP for East Somerset was dressed in a sharp double-breasted suit as he visited Weymouth and was joined by the similarly-dapper MP for South Dorset, Richard Drax.

item.title: Goat with prosthetic limbs is surrogate mother to triplet kids
item.description: Anna the goat lost her hind legs and large parts of her front legs to frost bite when she was born in an arctic freeze on a farm in 2015. Now, she is part of loving home in Pennsylvania, with four new legs.

item.title: Civil servant defends Alex Salmond sex complaints investigation
item.description: Permanent Secretary Leslie Evans said it would have been 'unconscionable' not to investigate the complaints against Scotland's former first minister Alex Salmond.

item.title: 'What happened to Joe Biden?' New Trump campaign ad asks
item.description: The Trump campaign launched a new ad Monday that tries to push the narrative that Democratic presidential candidate Joe Biden is suffering from cognitive decline.

item.title: Coronavirus could survive for LONGER in humid conditions, study finds
item.description: In an environment with high humidity - a high concentration of water vapour present in the air - these droplets travel up to 16 feet.

item.title: Iran 'paid bounties to Taliban to attack US troops in Afghanistan'
item.description: US intelligence determined that Iran paid the bounties to the Haqqani network, for the December 2019 attack on Bagram, in which two civilians were killed and more than 70 others injured.

item.title: Police flee crowd celebrating Pakistan Independence Day
item.description: Revellers gathered in Manchester's so-called 'Curry Mile' on Friday night, in breach of the city's reinforced lockdown rules which restrict outdoor gatherings to up to six people.

item.title: Police borrow powerboat to rescue man in Thames at 2am
item.description: Quick-thinking Kingston police officers were praised after they used a nearby powerboat to save a man who was struggling in the River Thames on August 6. The rescue was captured on bodycam.

item.title: Asian Brits are up to FIVE times more likely to catch coronavirus than white people
item.description: An Office for National Statistics (ONS) report released today revealed seven out of 1,510 Brits identifying as Asian swabbed positive for Covid-19 - a rate of around 0.46 per cent.

item.title: Finding Freedom book on Harry and Meghan tops UK charts
item.description: Finding Freedom sold 31,000 copies in the UK in the first five days of its release, according to new figures from data provider Nielsen Book.

item.title: Coronavirus deaths fall to ANOTHER low: Flu and pneumonia is now killing six times more people
item.description: Latest data from the Office for National Statistics revealed flu and pneumonia killed 1,013 people in England and Wales in the week up to August 7, compared to 152 Covid-19 victims.

item.title: Nearly three-quarters of coronavirus-infected people have NO symptoms on the day they are tested
item.description: Participants in the Coronavirus Infection Survey, representative of the UK, were tested for Covid-19. Of those who were positive, only 28 per cent had symptoms.

item.title: UK government considers auto lane-keep Level 3 road systems
item.description: This would allow drivers to legally use them to pilot their cars without having to keep their hands on the wheel, as they must currently do with systems such as Tesla's.

item.title: Coronavirus: Do parts of London and NYC have herd immunity?
item.description: Herd immunity could be as little as 10 per cent may need to be infected for the virus to fizzle out, experts say. Therefore London, New York and India may be on their way to achieving immunity.

item.title: Brand new £50m motorway junction is Britain's most expensive dead end
item.description: The M49, in Bristol, South Gloucestershire, was dubbed the most expensive dead end when it was not finished by late 2019. It was meant to link a distribution park to the motorway.

item.title: Manslaughter conviction for death of actor's daughter overturned
item.description: Rapper Ceon Broughton has had his conviction for the manslaughter of his girlfriend Louella Fletcher-Michie, who died after taking the drug 2C-P at Bestival, overturned by the Court of Appeal.

item.title: George Michael's ex Fadi Fawaz 'is arrested over string of hammer attacks on cars in east London'
item.description: Metropolitan Police officers reportedly arrested Fadi Fawaz in Bethnal Green, east London, on Friday, after a Mercedes, BMW and a Toyota were struck with a hammer, according to The Sun.

item.title: 41 starved dogs reduced to just skin and bones are rescued from a Spanish farm
item.description: WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT: A woman has been arrested and charged with animal abuse after police discovered 41 emaciated animals being kept on a 'terrible and unhygienic' farm in Spain.

item.title: Grandmother who survived two world wars and two pandemics celebrates her 103rd birthday
item.description: Great-great-grandmother Margaret Walton, who's 'fit as a fiddle', marked the milestone with a small socially-distant gathering at Hazeldene Residential Home, Blackburn.

item.title: Furious Bournemouth beach hut owners blast council for 'forcing them out'
item.description: Officials at Bournemouth Christchurch and Poole Council served notice on the beach hut owners at Durley Chine, Bournemouth, earlier this year.

item.title: Lockdown is eased in Leicester as beauty salons can reopen
item.description: Leicester will be brought partially out of its coronavirus local lockdown, with nail bars, outdoor pools, and beauty salons all allowed to reopen from tomorrow.

item.title: Exam regulator Ofqual chiefs had no prior education experience
item.description: Education Secretary Gavin Williamson has attempted to deflect the blame onto Ofqual, saying ministers had been assured that the algorithm 'would stand scrutiny' and that the regulator 'didn't deliver'.

item.title: Eight drinkers test positive for Covid after pub is closed
item.description: Those who visited the Empire Club in Stanley, County Durham between August 9 and 11 should self-isolate for 14 days from the date of their visit, authorities say.

item.title: Britain will be battered by high winds as some areas face up to a month's worth of rain today
item.description: Up to 1.96inches of rain could pour in just a few hours in parts of the UK today, potentially flooding homes, shutting roads and causing massive transport delays, the Met Office said.

item.title: Hezbollah member is found guilty over the 2005 murder of Lebanon's billionaire PM Rafic Hariri
item.description: Salim Ayyash, 56, was at the centre of an operation which tracked Mr Hariri's movements for months before a Mitsubishi truck laden with 2,200 pounds of TNT was driven at his motorcade in Beirut.

item.title: Abandoned funfair, empty Victorian baths and disused asylum among images captured by photographer
item.description: Simon Sugden, from Bradford, has visited more than 70 abandoned sites over the past decade to photograph disused asylums, empty Victorian baths and country homes

item.title: Bodybuilder, 47, heard himself being resuscitated by doctors THREE TIMES after he fell into a coma
item.description: Bodybuilder Simon Fan, 47, from Sutton Coldfield, Birmingham, lost five stone when he was placed in an induced coma following a diagnosis of Covid-19 and pneumonia back in March.

item.title: Professor who says he's the healthiest he's ever been at 84 shares his tips for ageing well
item.description: Professor Norman Lazarus, 84, from Surrey, has no age-related diseases and is medication free. He appeared on This Morning today where he revealed his 'trinity' of tips on ageing well.

item.title: British Museum: Specialists clean lockdown grime from exhibits
item.description: More than 30 expert cleaners have been wiping off the lockdown dust from the British Museum's artefacts before the venue reopens to visitors next week.

item.title: Mother, 26, dies after being told her cervical cancer symptoms were 'normal' due to contraception
item.description: Alexandra Hodson, 26, from Kirkham, Lancashire, was diagnosed with cervical cancer in June 2018 after attending the GP with a number of health problems that were dismissed as side effects.

item.title: Royal fans spot 'paint swatches' on the wall of Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's new home
item.description: Eagle-eyed royal fans noticed 'paint swatches' behind Prince Harry's, 35, shoulder during a recent video appearance, suggesting the royals may be redecorating their new home in California.

item.title: Daredevil leaps off moving train to plunge into river - and his only injury is a knocked-out tooth
item.description: Yaro Panchenko, from Kiev, Ukraine, jumped from a moving train and into the Dnieper river in a dangerous stunt. The heart-stopping moment was filmed by the 18-year-old on August 1.

item.title: Social media users mock intelligence agency GCHQ for spelling out c-word in online Twitter puzzle
item.description: An answer to one of the Cheltenham-based agency's regular puzzles had underlined the fourth letter in the names of the planets Mercury, Venus, Uranus and Neptune.

item.title: Millionaire developing Manchester's red light district admits homelessness is 'bad for business'
item.description: BBC2 documentary Manctopia: Billion Pound Property Boom lifts the lid on those affected by the rapid building going on in the city, including mother-of-two Christina, from Salford.

item.title: Poldark actress Ciara Charteris, 25, says she was raped five years ago by a friend
item.description: Poldark actress Ciara Charteris has said she was raped five years ago by a close friend in a candid open letter about the experience.

item.title: Kensington mansion once home to the Maharaja of Lahore's exiled son goes on sale for £15.5m
item.description: The stunning five-bedroom property in The Little Boltons was occupied by Victor Duleep Singh, son of the last Maharaja of Lahore Sir Duleep Singh - now part of Pakistan - during the Victorian era.

item.title: Rio Ferdinand is banned from driving for six months after speeding at 85mph in his new Mercedes
item.description: Former England and Manchester United star Rio Ferdinand broke the 70mph speed limit on the A27 dual carriageway in Hove, East Sussex last year.

item.title: Boy, 15, who sold ecstacy to 13-year-old who died AVOIDS jail
item.description: The teenage dealer pleaded guilty to supplying class A drugs following the death of Carson Price in Ystrad Mynach, near Caerphilly.

item.title: Coronavirus triggers inflammatory condition MIS-C in children
item.description: Researchers at King's College London discovered the illness, known as multisystem inflammatory syndrome in children (MIS-C), is unique and different to COVID-19 and Kawasaki Disease.

item.title: Teaching assistant, 28, is jailed for 32 months for having sex with pupil, 15, at Holiday Inn
item.description: Kellie Louise Smith, 28, started grooming her victim by bringing him sweets, and showering him with 'extra attention,' at his school in Coventry. She also bought him cannabis and cocaine.

item.title: Woman, 25, reveals she regularly 'smells' her mother
item.description: Appearing on sMothered tonight, Sarah, from Port St. Lucie, Florida, explains how she regularly stays at her 59-year-old mother Laurie's house, despite no longer living their together.

item.title: Clown and umbrella-wielding attacker fight outside McDonald's
item.description: A man and a clown were filmed during an unusual altercation outside Wood Green Shopping Centre in north London on Monday. Footage shows the man knock the clown's wig off with an umbrella.

item.title: Six UK National Parks for hikes, from Exmoor to Loch Lomond
item.description: There are an extraordinary 15 National Parks in the UK and they can get rather busy. Here we present six of the less famous parks that promise quieter paths and excellent places to eat and stay.

item.title: Crouchers Hotel Chichester review by the Daily Mail's Inspector
item.description: Crouchers Hotel is a 26-room property on the outskirts of Chichester. After a disappointing stay The Inspector declares that someone needs to crack the whip.

item.title: UK man falls to death from Corfu balcony in suspected suicide
item.description: The 46-year-old died just after midnight last night in the Kanoni region on the south of the island where he had been staying with his fiancée for a few days.

item.title: Sweden's Covid-19 expert comes under fire
item.description: Email exchanges appear to show Anders Tegnell discussing the option of keeping schools open to encourage herd immunity.

item.title: Personal trainer suing date for £130,000 after claiming she gave him a cold sore when they kissed
item.description: Martin Ashley Conway, 45, claims he has been left 'traumatised' after catching the herpes simplex cold sore virus through kissing date Jovanna Lovelace, in her 30s, in London last year.

item.title: Did Gavin Willamson's 'sinister' photos include 'whip' warning?
item.description: Tory MPs believe Gavin Williamson was sending a warning to his enemies when he posed for photographs in his office with a whip on his desk after announcing the A-level results U-turn.

item.title: How restoring your handbag could add THOUSANDS to its value
item.description: Charlotte Staerck, co-founder of UK-based Handbag Clinic, told FEMAIL that their treatments regularly add hundreds - and sometimes thousands - of pounds to the value of leather bags.

item.title: Eva Longoria opens the Democrats' convention saying 'the past four years have left us diminished'
item.description: The Democratic National Convention kicked off Monday night with remarks from Eva Longoria before a montage ensued of Americans reciting the preamble of the U.S. Constitution.

item.title: Flight of friendship: Israeli and German fighter jets flyover Dachau death camp
item.description: Israeli F-16s and Eurofighter jets of the German Luftwaffe are taking part in two weeks of military exercises, the first time the Israeli Air Force has trained on German soil.

item.title: Organisers of vegan camping festival accused of 'playing Russian roulette' with people's lives
item.description: Health experts are concerned Vegan Camp Out near Alfreton, Derbyshire, could pose a 'significant' health risk when it takes place next month.

item.title: Student, 18, 'predicted' exams crisis in an award-winning story she penned last year
item.description: Jessica Johnson, 18, from Stalybridge, Greater Manchester, won an Orwell Youth Prize Senior award for her dystopian story A Band Apart which saw pupils split into bands according to social status.

item.title: People share the most awkward mistakes committed by people who are clearly in the wrong profession
item.description: From Finland to the UK, social media users have shared hilarious examples of employees who let their professional standards slip.

item.title: Coronavirus Japan: Chinese baby tests positive upon landing
item.description: The girl landed in Tokyo with her mother on Sunday and was found to carry coronavirus by medical staff at the airport, Chinese officials said. She had passed the virus checks before leaving China.

item.title: Keen outdoorsman spends £30 online on two-man tent that turns out to be only one foot tall
item.description: David Adam, an avid camper from Glasgow, burst out laughing when he opened his brand new 'three-second pop up tent' delivery and found a tiny, already-assembled, foot-tall tent.

item.title: German police officer 'kneels' on neck of boy, 15, in shock video
item.description: Police were called to break up a riot in Dusseldorf, western Germany, on Saturday when the 15-year-old boy allegedly assaulted officers, leading them to pin him to the ground.

item.title: President Xi Jinping is facing widespread opposition within his Communist Party, insider claims
item.description: Cai Xia, a retired professor in democratic politics, made the remarks after being expelled from the Chinese Communist Party for allegedly calling Xi a 'mafia boss' and his party a 'political zombie'.

item.title: Tributes are paid to the four young men killed when car they were in crashed into a house
item.description: The victims, named locally as Corey Owen, Ryan Nelson, Jordan Rawlings and Matthew Parke, died in the 'horrific collision' in Derry Hill near Calne, Wilshire on Sunday.

item.title: Marks & Spencer will axe 7,000 jobs in the next three months
item.description: Retail giant Marks & Spencer has said it plans to cut around 7,000 jobs over the next three months across stores, regional management and its support centre.

item.title: Youthful-looking mother, 50, who's mistaken for her daughters' SISTER
item.description: Rajan Gill, 50, from Coventry, West Midlands, is often mistaken for daughters' sister. Cashiers have sometimes confused her and her daughters Jasmine, 19, and Neelam, 25.

item.title: Cineworld pins hopes of a COVID recovery on 4D cinemas
item.description: The UK's largest cinema chain, Cineworld, is among theatres pinning their hopes on more immersive experiences as part of its Covid lockdown recovery efforts.

item.title: Ontario mother shared video of her delivering her own baby in a bathtub with 700k Youtube viewers
item.description: Legaci Allong, 24, from Ontario, Canada, documents every aspect of her life, including the birth of her youngest son and the moment she found out she had a miscarriage, for her Youtube followers.

item.title: Home Office books 4,000 hotel rooms for asylum seekers
item.description: Hotels in Hull, Birmingham, Nottingham, Southport and Glasgow have been used amid a shortage of permanent homes for newcomers to live while their asylum claims are assessed.

item.title: Prince Charles 'will not renew lease' on 900-acre 'Duchy Originals' farm after 35 years
item.description: The royal, 71, will not renew the lease on Home Farm in Gloucester, one of the main farms to supply the luxury Waitrose Duchy Organic brand, when its current term ends in April 2020.

item.title: Shoppers made two million fewer trips to the supermarket after face masks became compulsory
item.description: Footfall in stores and grocers has been steadily climbing since the peak of the pandemic, with each household currently averaging 14 trips per month.

item.title: Depression rates have DOUBLED since coronavirus hit Britain
item.description: The Office for National Statistics found 9.7 per cent of adults were depressed between July last year and March. The figure had risen to 19.2 per cent when the same group was assessed in June.

item.title: Liverpool record positive coronavirus test during pre-season training camp in Austria
item.description: The Reds are preparing for the defence of their Premier League title in Austria but an unnamed member of the travelling party has tested positive for coronavirus, according to reports.

item.title: Police launch probe into footage showing officer yelling 'chill out or I'll choke you'
item.description: The video showed how the officer pushed the man up against a car in Halifax, West Yorkshire, before pulling him to the ground on a road while arresting him on suspicion of assault.

item.title: Japanese designer unveils TRANSPARENT public toilets
item.description: Acclaimed architect Shigeru Ban came up with the idea which he said was intended as a practical way to allow users to check for cleanliness as well as whether the toilet was occupied or not.

item.title: Grand-daughter of Roald Dalh Sophie said she struggled with the pressure of his legacy
item.description: Sophie Dahl, 42, who lives in Buckinghamshire with her family said she would not get out of bed if she took on the responsibility of carrying her grand-father Roald Dahl's literary legacy.

item.title: Woman, 25, with painful red acne on her cheeks was told by trolls her skin is 'beyond help'
item.description: Jessica Mackensie, 25, from Edinburgh, developed acne four years ago and has since been learning how to feel confident in her new skin by sharing skin positive images on Instagram.

item.title: Shocking moment man jumps onto a WHALE SHARK and 'rides' the back of the animal by clinging to fin
item.description: The stuntman, named locally as Zaki Al-sabahy, was filmed sitting on the bow of a yacht as he eyed up the sharks swimming close to the port city of Yanbu, Saudi Arabia.

item.title: Pre-teen sips of alcohol 'could lead to binge-drinking in adolescence
item.description: Australian researchers investigated whether supply of alcohol during adolescence, either in sips or whole drinks, was associated with drinking behaviours in later life.

item.title: An address to make a splash
item.description: The sea defence, known as Grain Tower Battery, is located on a spit of land near the Isle of Grain in Kent, where the Thames and Medway meet.

item.title: Obesity: Living near a busy road with lots of traffic noise increases risk of weight gain
item.description: British experts found that living near a high-traffic road was associated with both higher body mass indices and waist circumferences in the UK and Norway.

item.title: Costa del Sol tourists who flout new smoking ban face a £2,700 fine
item.description: The smoking ban, announced last week by Spanish Health Minister Salvador Illa, is nationwide and prevents people from lighting up in public when social distancing of six feet cannot be guaranteed.

item.title: Baby orang-utans are ferried to 'nursery' by wheelbarrow in adorable footage
item.description: Baby orang-utans at Borneo Orang-utan Survival Foundation in Indonesia are ferried to nursery in wheelbarrows, as the orphanage realised the baby apes could not keep up on the commute.

item.title: Boyfriend shaves girlfriend's head as she copes with alopecia - and turns the clippers on himself
item.description: Eva Barilaro, from Monaco, has alopecia and asked her boyfriend Damien Fabre, 26, to shave her head. But the 23-year-old did not expect her boyfriend to shave his own head in solidarity.

item.title: Oxford-educated NHS consultant surgeon, 40, stole £5.50 throat spray from Sainsbury's
item.description: Ryan Wood, 40, was stopped by a Sainsbury's store detective after he was spotted taking a £5.50 throat spray from a shelf and placing it in his pocket at the store in Ipswich, Suffolk last year.

item.title: Chilling 'James Bond style' gadgets used by British secret agents in World War Two emerge for sale
item.description: A haul of 'James Bond style,' gadgets including miniature cameras and blades hidden in pipes, pens and pencils is set to fetch up to £3,000 when it goes up for auction this week.

item.title: Wobbly moment! Canoeists struggle to paddle through a swarm of jellyfish the size of dinner plates
item.description: A group of canoeists had to paddle through a swarm of jellyfish in the Sea of Azov off the the coast of Berdyansk, Ukraine. Footage, shared online on August 15, shows the unnerving encounter.

item.title: Law should require electric cars to make up one in six new cars sold
item.description: With the latest electric models becoming more affordable and offering longer driving ranges between charges, a charity says ministers should force the hand of car firms to sell more of them.

item.title: Answers to your questions after A-level and GCSE U-turn chaos
item.description: Students in England have been told their A-level grades will now be based on teachers' assessments - if they were higher than the moderated grades they received.

item.title: 15 horses are mutilated across France as police hunt mystery attackers
item.description: WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT: Police in France are hunting a gang of twisted criminals who have been mutilating live horses and taking their eyes, ears, and parts of their bones.

item.title: Airlines plead with Boris Johnson to introduce airport coronavirus tests to get round quarantine
item.description: The chief executives of British Airways, TUI, easyJet and Virgin Atlantic wrote to the Prime Minister, warning him that major routes to important world centres are at risk.

item.title: Father discovers angry note calling him 'fat' for parking in a Tesco parent space
item.description: Gilly Patel was branded 'fat,' by another driver who left a note on his car after parking in a parents' bay outside a Tesco supermarket in Coventry on Sunday.

item.title: Newborn with tumour ONE-AND-A-HALF times bigger than her defies doctors to survive
item.description: Zalya Schier, one, could have been aborted when her parents Lenai, 32, and Matt, 31, discovered a tumour one and a half times bigger than herself on her back - but defied doctors and survived.

item.title: Anger as data watchdog Elizabeth Denham spends three months working from home - in CANADA
item.description: She has been based on the other side of the Atlantic for the past two months, in a time zone eight hours behind staff in London. The £180,000 per year official is not due back until next month.

item.title: Children are far less likely to catch coronavirus in the classroom than they are at home
item.description: Belgium's national health body found transmission rates of Covid-19 at schools were far lower than in the home. The findings are likely to give a major boost to Government ministers.

item.title: Can you spot the NAKED model hiding in each of these images?
item.description: The models were carefully painted before being placed in a scene of nature where they expertly blended in with their surroundings in a process which takes several hours.

item.title: Beautiful Elizabethan manor house that inspired Beatrix Potter is for sale for £1m
item.description: Hardcragg Hall, on the market for £1million, was built in 1563 and is believed to be the oldest house in Grange-over-Sands in Cumbria. Beatrix Potter was friends with the house's owners.

item.title: Curious cub peeks through house door before mama bear drags it away after night-time visit
item.description: A family were stunned to wake up and find a bear cub playing outside their home in Boone, North Carolina. Video footage, from August 10, shows the naughty bear get dragged away by its mother.

item.title: Senior Tory MPs demand Dominic Cummings answer questions over defence review role
item.description: Senior MPs have demanded Dominic Cummings submit to questioning about his involvement in a major review of the UK's defence and security capabilities.

item.title: Putin warns the world not to interfere in Belarus
item.description: The Russian President spoke with the German Chancellor by telephone today following outcry in the West over the dubious election results and the ensuing crackdown by Alexander Lukashenko.

item.title: Mercedes spins out of control and narrowly misses a car as it smashes into petrol station forecourt
item.description: A driver lost control of a black Mercedes on the A20 bypass in Swanley on Saturday, spinning off the rain-soaked road before crashing into a pump and a parked car at the BP garage, CCTV shows.

item.title: Youthful Hong Kong actress who has barely aged in 30 years reveals she is 54
item.description: Carman Lee Yeuk-tung's flawless skin, ageless looks and incredibly toned physique make it hard for anyone to believe she is in her mid-50s. She revealed her age on Sunday while celebrating her birthday.

item.title: Flat for sale has a Fifty Shades of Grey inspired room with a sex chair and toys
item.description: The Paris is owned by the controversial designer and sexual anthropologist Betony Vernon - and it is on the market for £1.42m. Artwork and furnishings are an optional extra.

item.title: Next year's rail fare increases should be scrapped, says transport watchdog
item.description: Transport Focus is demanding a radical shake-up of the ticketing system after alarming polling found two-thirds of pre-lockdown commuters would continue to work from home.

item.title: Senior black Met Police inspector claims he was racially profiled
item.description: Charles Ehikioya, 55, claimed the officers stopped him without justification in Croydon, South London, and has complained of racial harassment to Scotland Yard following the incident,

item.title: Cheap mortgages may soon be a thing of the past as experts warn 'perfect storm' could push up rates
item.description: A cocktail of uncertainty about the future of house prices, millions facing redundancy and a huge surge in demand from borrowers seeking loans after the recent stamp duty cut has put the brakes on.

item.title: Woman who used a Katie Price-endorsed blackhead vacuum says she got burns all over her face
item.description: Safia Hartwell, 24, from Norwich, said she was left with horrible burns all over her face and looked as if she had been 'beaten up' after using a blackhead remover endorsed by Katie Price and other celebrities.

item.title: Boy who was thrown 100 feet from Tate Modern balcony by Jonty Bravery enjoys first weekend at home
item.description: The French boy was six years old when autistic teenager Jonty Bravery hurled him from the Tate Modern's 100ft viewing platform in London on August 4 last year.

item.title: Thug blinds hairdresser, 18, in one eye by hurling remote control at her face
item.description: Natasha Robinson was struck by the device when it was thrown back at her by Tyler Basnett, who had inadvertently been injured by the remote moments earlier in Derbyshire.

item.title: EastEnders' £87m set is almost complete with a leafy Albert Square and painted Queen Vic pub
item.description: The extensive project, which has been built next door to the original set, appeared to be nearing its first stages of completion in new images revealed on Saturday.

item.title: Piers Morgan and wife Celia burgled as they slept at luxury French villa
item.description: Celia Walden, 44, hit out at the culprits who targeted their holiday home in Côte d'Azur on Thursday after they made off with money from her handbag as well as a handful of jewellery.

item.title: Clown' Gavin Williamson is savaged by the British press over exams 'farce'
item.description: The Daily Mail used the headline 'Another fine mess', with a cartoon of Prime Minister Boris Johnson and Education Secretary Gavin Williamson as Laurel and Hardy.

item.title: Broadcaster James Whale considered taking his own life after cancer diagnosis
item.description: James Whale said he considered euthanasia at 'the place in Switzerland' after he was given his cancer diagnosis just two years after he lost his wife Melinda to the devastating disease.

item.title: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: Jon Andrewes enjoyed a successful career despite lacking qualifications
item.description: RICHARD LITTLEJOHN: Jon Andrewes, who had managed to obtain a string of high-profile public sector jobs based on bogus CVs with an impressive list of false academic qualifications...

item.title: Nicola Sturgeon rejects calls for an urgent inquiry into Scotland's Covid-19 care home scandal
item.description: It was revealed at the weekend that at least 37 patients - in Ayrshire and Arran, Grampian, Tayside, Fife and Lanarkshire - who had tested positive were discharged into care homes.

item.title: Can YOU guess the celebrity from their home office?
item.description: UK-based Hammonds Furniture has created seven celebrity home office brainteasers; imagining how seven well-known names have set themselves up for working from home.

item.title: Plane shocking! Pilots lift the lid on what REALLY goes on in the cockpit
item.description: Pilots from around the world share the details of their working life that you'd probably rather not know on Q&A site Quora. From dangerous landing competitions to virtual chess.

item.title: Dozens of Antifa protesters smashed windows and vandalized Whole Foods and Apple store in Brooklyn
item.description: Antifa members spray painted anti-police graffiti and messages like 'Murder Bezos' as they vandalized Apple, Whole Foods, and HSBC Bank locations in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, late on Saturday night.

item.title: Makeup artist enhances her natural assets using products in her EXACT colour only
item.description: An Australian beauty blogger has created the ultimate 'no makeup' makeup look using products that exactly match the colour of her hair and skin - calling it her 'perfect' face.

item.title: PE teacher Belinda Norton reveals how she changed her workouts to get her body in shape again
item.description: PE teacher Belinda Norton said she went 'too hard' at the gym when it re-opened following the closure for COVID-19 and ended up becoming 'too muscular'. Now the Gold Coast teacher has changed it.

item.title: Self-taught baker Walla Abu-Eid, 31, shares three-ingredient recipe for her 'lazy' chocolate cake
item.description: Sydney woman Walla Abu-Eid's ingeniously simple biscuit cake is perfect for busy mothers strapped for time.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... Gavin's schoolboy error
item.description: PAUL THOMAS on... Gavin Williamson's schoolboy error

item.title: YouTuber aims to take down 'mask-holes' with gun that fires surgical mask at your face
item.description: YouTuber Allen Pan built a gun that fires a surgical mask on to a person's face in order to take down anti-maskers. 'An American problem demands an American solution,' Pan said.

item.title: Couple caught having sex during Brazil council video conference
item.description: The chair of the meeting Leonel Brizola, who continued the discussion despite the scenes being relayed through the video feed.

item.title: Good news for men: People get better at multi-tasking by practising simple challenges
item.description: Practising doing several tasks at once results in improved information transfer between the putamen, deep in the brain, and the outer regions of the brain.

item.title: Man gets revenge on fly-tipper who dumped 400 tyres on his land
item.description: A farmer plagued by a fly-tipper who dumped 421 tyres on his land got his own back - after placing them in a truck and depositing them back on HIS doorstep

item.title: Flytippers dump mountain of junk on 4,000-year-old Bronze Age burial ground in Wales
item.description: Visitors to the home of a 4000-year-old Bronze Age burial mound in Wales were shocked to find it trashed with mounds of rubbish including sofas, kitchen appliances and rotting food.

item.title: Flat shown after Johnny Depp 'threw a phone at Amber Heard'
item.description: The images were taken by a friend of Heard's and show glass shattered all over the floor at the LA penthouse she shared with Depp.
